How can I shape the extruded portion to be a circle or make an adapter part? http://imgur.com/23GqBlC

Edited July 30, 2013 by Retro.Humanoid
I'm a 3dsmax user so I don't know what tools Blender has. But it's an extremely simple shape - why not just remake the cylinder again with more sides?

In blender, you'll just have to add a cylinder from the looks of it and shape it so that it looks like a part of the original piece.

Basically, you're going to stick a cylinder that's been flattened on top of that original piece, and your going to have to make a sort of adapter plate so the original piece smoothly transitions into the circular top part.

That's the only way I can think of making it circular enough to be an adapter plate; if you want, you can make the adapter plate look like that as well.
Yeah, As mr. Desmond says, a cylinder that has one face ripped off, and the edge verteces of that merged until it "flows" No real quick way to do it"That I know of"
